snippet: The reaction to the collision between Morgan Brian and Alexandra Popp further raised questions about whether FIFA was more concerned about the players’ interest than its own.
abstract: Jere Longman On Soccer column holds that determination of whether player can remain in game after sustaining hit to the head should rest with unbiased observer, not team doctor; notes American midfielder Morgan Brian and German striker Alexandra Popp returned to field minutes after major collision during their Women's World Cup semifinal match, reigniting debate about FIFA's commitment to player safety.
lead_paragraph: The reaction to the collision between Morgan Brian and Alexandra Popp further raised questions about whether FIFA was more concerned about the players’ interest than its own.

headline.print_headline: After Heads Bang, Interests Collide for FIFA
headline.main: After Heads Bang, Interests Collide for FIFA

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Women's National Soccer Team
